intro: Ourisia racemosa, commonly known as the yellow fairybells, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ourisia racemosa is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
